backward_pawns.title: Backward Pawns
description: A backward pawn is a pawn whose neighbouring pawns have advanced past it, meaning that it is the only pawn amongst its neighbours
which cannot be defended by another pawn in its current location.
Backward pawns are typically a
weakness; if they cannot be easily advanced, they must be guarded by pieces instead of by other pawns, which necessitates
tying those pieces down to their defence.
If a backward pawn is captured, its neighbouring pawns may also then become backward pawns as a consequence, resulting

disintegrating as the weak spots multiply.

piece_vision.title: Piece Vision
description: Piece vision, or coverage, refers to the squares that a piece or pawn can capture another piece or pawn on from
its current location. A piece or pawn which is able to capture on a particular square is said to be able to 'see'
that square.
